intro: Micranthes menthoides, commonly known as small mintweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are often described as resembling those of mint. Its flowers are typically yellow and clustered in small, round heads, which are borne on slender peduncles. Micranthes menthoides is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
